content: Please note that if you have shared them with someone, they will become unavailable.

comment.text: This translation key is used for a confirmation message that explains what happens when shared notes are deleted. It informs users that deleted notes will be unavailable to those they've shared with. This appears in a delete dialog component.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'فسيصبحوا غير متاحين' is overly formal for this context. A more natural and user-friendly translation would be better suited.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: يرجى العلم أنه إذا شاركتهم مع شخص آخر، فلن يتمكنوا من الوصول إليهم.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The semicolon (;) after 'أحدهم' disrupts the flow and is not common in this type of phrasing.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Remove the semicolon. Use a comma instead.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "onları əlçatan olmayacaq" doesn't quite capture the meaning of 'unavailable'. While 'ələlçatan' means 'accessible,' 'unavailable' implies a removal or inaccessibility due to deletion. A more accurate translation would convey that the shared items will disappear or can no longer be accessed.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Nəzərə alın ki, əgər onları kiminləsə paylaşmısınızsa, onlar silinəcək və paylaşan şəxslər üçün görünməz olacaq.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While not a major issue, the sentence structure could be slightly improved for better flow in Azerbaijani. The phrasing can feel a little stiff.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Nəzərə alın ki, onları paylaşdığınız şəxslər üçün onlar silinəcək.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'die Daten nicht mehr verfügbar sind' (the data is no longer available) is a more general statement than the original 'they will become unavailable'. The original implies a more active change in availability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bitte beachten Sie, dass diese nicht mehr verfügbar sind, wenn Sie diese mit jemandem geteilt haben.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of 'diese' (these) is slightly awkward and less natural than a more direct reference to the items being deleted. While grammatically correct, it doesn't flow as well.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bitte beachten Sie, dass sie nicht mehr verfügbar sind, wenn Sie diese mit jemandem geteilt haben.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation is overly formal and doesn't quite capture the natural tone of the English original. 'Ole hyvä ja huomioi' is quite formal. A more natural phrasing would be more appropriate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Huomioithan, että jos olet jakanut tiedot jonkun kanssa, ne eivät ole enää saatavilla.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The repetition of 'ne tiedot' is slightly awkward. The pronoun can be omitted in Finnish in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Huomioithan, että jos olet jakanut tiedot jonkun kanssa, ne eivät ole enää saatavilla.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Armenian translation uses the imperfect form 'կդառնան' which, while grammatically correct, might sound slightly awkward or less direct in this context. A more direct, future tense form could be preferred for clarity.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using the future tense: 'դառնան:' (darnan) instead of 'կդառնան:' (kdarnan).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'they will become unavailable' is not perfectly conveyed by '利用できなくなりますのでご注意ください'. While understandable, '利用できなくなります' focuses on the usability aspect. A more accurate translation that maintains the original meaning would be something along the lines of '共有相手に利用できなくなります' (the shared person will no longer be able to use it) or '共有相手には利用できなくなる点にご注意ください' (please note that they will no longer be able to use them).
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 共有相手に利用できなくなります

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "they will become unavailable" is not accurately reflected in the Korean translation. "사용할 수 없게 되므로" translates to "they will become unusable". While close, 'unavailable' implies a temporary restriction, while 'unusable' suggests a permanent one. The nuance is lost.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 사용할 수 없게 됩니다. (They will become unavailable.) - More closely aligns with the original meaning and implies a restriction rather than a permanent state.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Korean sentence uses a slightly abrupt tone. Adding a softer connector or phrasing could improve flow.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 사용할 수 없게 되므로, 다른 사람과 공유하신 경우에 주의하시기 바랍니다. (Adding '에' after '경우' softens the tone)

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Lao translation 'ພວກເຂົາຈະກາຍເປັນບໍ່ມີ' (puak khao ja kay pen bor mi) literally translates to 'they will become nonexistent'. A more accurate translation of 'unavailable' would convey the idea of being inaccessible or not able to be used.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ກະ​ລຸ​ນາ​ສັງ​ເກດ​ວ່າ​ຖ້າ​ຫາກ​ວ່າ​ທ່ານ​ໄດ້​ແບ່ງ​ປັນ​ໃຫ້​ເຂົາ​ເຈົ້າ​ກັບ​ຜູ້​ໃດ​ຜູ້​ຫນຶ່ງ​, ພວກ​ເຂົາ​ຈະ​ບໍ່​ສາ​ມາດ​ໃຊ້​ໄດ້​ອີກ.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The punctuation may be improved for better readability. While not strictly incorrect, consistent punctuation is preferred.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ກະ​ລຸ​ນາ​ສັງ​ເກດ​ວ່າ​ຖ້າ​ຫາກ​ວ່າ​ທ່ານ​ໄດ້​ແບ່ງ​ປັນ​ໃຫ້​ເຂົາ​ເຈົ້າ​ກັບ​ຜູ້​ໃດ​ຜູ້​ຫນຶ່ງ​, ພວກ​ເຂົາ​ຈະ​ບໍ່​ສາ​ມາດ​ໃຊ້​ໄດ້​ອີກ​ເນາະ​፡፡

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'tos' is a masculine plural accusative pronoun. While it might be correct depending on what 'them' refers to, it's ambiguous and potentially incorrect without context.  It's unclear whether 'them' refers to singular or plural items.  Using 'tas' (singular neuter accusative) is potentially more appropriate if 'them' refers to a single shared note, but this is context-dependent.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider revising to 'ja to kopīgojāt ar kādu personu, tas kļūs nepieejams.' (if 'them' refers to a single shared note) or 'ja tos kopīgojāt ar kādu personu, tie kļūs nepieejami.' (if 'them' refers to plural items).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While the translation conveys the general meaning, a more natural-sounding and direct translation of 'they will become unavailable' would be 'tie vairs nebūs pieejami'. The current translation 'tas kļūs nepieejams' sounds a bit awkward and literal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Replace 'tas kļūs nepieejams' with 'tie vairs nebūs pieejami'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation "aceste vor deveni indisponibile" is slightly awkward. 'Aceste' (these) doesn't quite flow as naturally as a more general term.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vă rugăm să rețineți că, dacă le-ați partajat cu altcineva, ele vor deveni indisponibile.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'partajat' is a conjugated form of 'a partaja'. While technically correct, 'împărțit' is a more common and natural word choice for 'shared' in this context.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Vă rugăm să rețineți că, dacă le-ați împărțit cu altcineva, ele vor deveni indisponibile.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'ඔහුට/ඇයට ද අහිමි වන බව කරුණාවෙන් සලකන්න' doesn't fully convey the meaning of 'they will become unavailable.' 'අහිමි වන' implies loss of possession, while the English refers to unavailability of access. A better translation would focus on access restriction rather than possession loss.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: මෙය යමෙක් සමඟ බෙදාගෙන ඇත්නම්, ඔහුට/ඇයටද එය ලබා ගැනීමට බැරිවනු ඇත.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The phrase 'ඔහුට/ඇයට' is unnecessarily complex and potentially confusing. While grammatically correct, a simpler phrasing would enhance readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: මෙය යමෙක් සමඟ බෙදාගෙන ඇත්නම්, ඔවුන්ටද එය ලබා ගැනීමට බැරිවනු ඇත.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Upoštevajte, da ti ne bodo na voljo, če ste jih dali v skupno rabo z nekom drugim' is a bit literal and not as natural as it could be. 'Ti' (you) is a bit ambiguous.  It's unclear who 'you' refers to - the user or the recipient of the shared note.  The English implies it's about the original user.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Upoštevajte, da jih ne bodo na voljo, če ste jih delili z nekom drugim.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation uses 'delili' which implies a more general sharing. While accurate, 'dali v skupno rabo' is somewhat verbose for a UI tooltip/message. A slightly more concise phrasing would improve readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider 'Upoštevajte, da ne bodo na voljo, če ste jih delili z nekom drugim.' for brevity.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation 'они ц́е постати недоступни' is not the most natural or accurate rendering of 'they will become unavailable'.  'Ц́е' is a future tense marker which is not strictly needed here and sounds a bit formal. A more fluent translation would use a simpler future form.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Имајте на уму да ако их поделите са неким, они ће бити недоступни.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The use of Cyrillic script is correct, but the overall phrasing could be more aligned with common Serbian usage. 'недоступни' is correct, but 'бити недоступни' reads better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: No change in the word itself, but adjust the sentence structure (see suggestion for incorrect translation).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'ih' is ambiguous. While grammatically correct in context, it might be clearer to specify 'njih' to explicitly indicate 'them'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Imajte na umu da ako ih/njih podelite sa nekim, oni će postati nedostupni.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While 'oni će postati nedostupni' is grammatically correct, it can be slightly improved for a more natural flow. Using a more active construction would enhance readability.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Imajte na umu da ako ih/njih podelite sa nekim, neće biti dostupni.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'kullanılamayacaklarını lütfen unutmayın' is a bit literal and awkward. A more natural Turkish phrasing would be something like 'onları kullanamayacaklarını unutmayın' or 'onlar kullanılamaz hale gelecek'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Onları kullanılamaz hale geleceklerini unutmayın.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While grammatically correct, the sentence structure 'Bunları birisiyle paylaştıysanız kullanılamayacaklarını lütfen unutmayın' is slightly clunky. Placing 'lütfen' (please) at the end is less common in this type of warning.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Bunları birisiyle paylaştıysanız, kullanılamayacaklarını unutmayın.
